comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: There was a Welsh peer named Henry Vivian, but of an earlier era: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Vivian,_1st_Baron_Swansea and there was this fellow (1912 story from NYTimes): Henry Vivian, Chairman of the Co-partnership Tenant's Movement in England and an ex-member of Parliament from Birkenhead, described the growth of the garden city idea in England last night at a dinner given to him at the City Club by Frederic Howe, Director of the People's Institute.

comment.author: 9373689@N03
comment._content: It seems likely that this is Henry Harvey Vivian. There's another picture of him on Flickr showing him and the suggestion there is that this is a picture of people at the International Conference for the British American Peace Centenary (1914-1915), held in New York, May 5-10, 1913. The General prospectus of that event has a Henry Vivian MP in attendance plus the others named in the other photo. Henry Harvey Vivian had till 1910 been an MP. As far as I've been able to find out there was no other Henry Vivian who was an MP in 1913. He is on record many times calling for e reduction in UK expenditure on arms and made pacifist suggestions for the Seond Hague Peace Conference in 1907. After the war he became deeply involved in the League of Nations. It seems to fit.

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: hjuk: Thanks for putting together the pieces.  He does appear to be the same man as in the Bain photos of the Anglo-American Peace Centenary (1814-1914) Committee.  We'll add some identifying information when we next update the description.
